meanings.definition: A platform or compartment housed in a shaft for raising and lowering people or goods to different floors or levels in a building.
meanings.sent1: The elevators in the building help people go up and down easily.
meanings.sent2: We took the elevators to the top floor of the hotel.
meanings.sent3: The elevators in the mall always seem to know when I need them most.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter lifted him up like an elevator to cloud nine.
meanings.sent5: The elevator hummed softly as it carried us to the sky-high view.

meanings.definition: A mechanical device used for lifting or lowering objects.
meanings.sent1: The warehouse uses elevators to move heavy boxes from one floor to another.
meanings.sent2: The construction site had multiple elevators to transport materials.
meanings.sent3: The elevator in the factory had a mind of its own, always going up when it should go down.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as an elevator, lifting her spirits in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The elevator creaked as it lifted the crate to the top shelf.

meanings.definition: A muscle that raises a part of the body.
meanings.sent1: Her elevators, or calf muscles, were sore after the long hike.
meanings.sent2: He felt a twinge in his elevators after running up the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The elevators in his legs protested as he climbed the steep hill.
meanings.sent4: His elevators flexed powerfully as he jumped over the hurdle.
meanings.sent5: The elevators in her legs were strong from years of dancing.
